Learn Node Part 11: Basic React

Saturday, February 14, 2015

Overview

I’ve heard some nice things about Facebook’s ReactJS Framework. So here’s how to setup React with Node. You can find more information here

1 ### in shell ###
2 
3 # look at my bower tutorial on how to setup bower
4 $ npm install --save bower
5 
6 $ npm install --save express-jsx
7 $ bower install --save react

React’s syntax is really verbose, so they use JSX. Manually compiling jsx is a pain so we’re going to use express-jsx which compiles the jsx in real time. Lets start.

1 // ### in app.js ###
2 
3 // add near the top
4 var jsxCompile = require('express-jsx');
5 
6 // order is important
7 app.use(jsxCompile(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));
8 app.use(express.static(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));

Now we’re going to modify the ejs file and make it use react.

1 <!-- ### in index.ejs ### -->
2 
3 <div id="test"></div>
4 
5 <script type="text/javascript" src="bower_components/react/react.min.js"></script>
6 <script src="javascripts/test.js"></script>

Remember that when test.js is requested, express-jsx middleware will look for a matching .jsx file. This means we need a test.jsx file.

1 // ### in test.jsx ###
2 
3 /** @jsx React.DOM */
4 "use strict"
5 
6 React.renderComponent(
7   <h1>I am printing the title from react, works!</h1>,
8   document.getElementById('test')
9 );
